meanings.definition: To throw or move with great force
meanings.sent1: He lanched the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: She lanched the paper airplane into the air.
meanings.sent3: The strong wind lanched the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent4: The rocket lanched into space with a loud roar.
meanings.sent5: The angry player lanched the ball out of frustration.

meanings.definition: To pierce or cut open with a sharp instrument
meanings.sent1: The chef lanched the tomato with a knife.
meanings.sent2: She lanched the balloon with a needle.
meanings.sent3: The pirate lanched the treasure chest to find the gold.
meanings.sent4: The dentist lanched the abscess to drain it.
meanings.sent5: The tailor lanched the fabric to create a pattern.

meanings.definition: To launch or set in motion
meanings.sent1: They lanched the boat into the water.
meanings.sent2: The company lanched a new product last week.
meanings.sent3: The magician lanched the trick with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher lanched the lesson with an interesting story.
meanings.sent5: The conductor lanched the orchestra into a beautiful symphony.
